thread.title: Last 3 days: Make a change and vote for Brtain's most inspirational Digital Hero 2015
thread.title_full: Last 3 days: Make a change and vote for Brtain's most inspirational Digital Hero 2015

author: mirror
title: Last 3 days: Make a change and vote for Brtain's most inspirational Digital Hero 2015
text:
Get daily news by email Invalid e-mail Thanks for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later These inspirational volunteers need YOUR help 
Earlier this year, we asked you to put forward your local Digital Heroes so they can be nominated for this year's awards. 
The projects have finally been shortlisted to 49 - and now we're asking you to nominate a deserving project to win £10,000 and the title of TalkTalk Digital Hero 2015. 
Picked from hundreds of entries all across the UK, 49 nominees have the chance to be awarded at the House of Commons before an esteemed judging panel. 
As a category winner they would claim a £4,000 grant and be in with a chance to scoop the title of TalkTalk Digital Hero 2015 and £10,000 of funding. 
The TalkTalk Digital Heroes Awards sit at the heart of the TalkTalk Digital Heroes Foundation and are part of a wider initiative to help make communities better off through being online - show your support today . 
To date, funding to the tune of nearly £500,000 has been provided to 78 projects across Britain. 
The Digital Heroes Awards are run in partnership with the charities Citizens Online and Go ON UK, which aims to make the UK the world's most digitally skilled nation. 
TalkTalk chairman Sir Charles Dunstone, Lastminute.com founder Baroness Martha Lane-Fox and Mirror editor-in-chief Lloyd Embley will be judging the shortlist and will pick an overall winner who will receive £10,000. 
Browse the finalists and register your votes at talktalkdigitalheroes.co.uk . 
Voting will be open until Tuesday 8 September 2015 and votes can be cast for any category. View the full category list here.
